notes: Seventh-generation Legacy midsize sedan features Subaru Global Platform. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Turbo engine optional on XT trim. CVT continuously variable transmission standard across lineup. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Legacy article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Sixth-generation Outback features Subaru Global Platform with increased ground clearance. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Turbo engine optional on XT trim. Popular crossover-wagon with rugged capability. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Outback article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Fifth-generation Forester compact SUV on Subaru Global Platform. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. No turbocharged engine option in this generation. X-Mode off-road system available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Forester article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Fifth-generation WRX performance sedan with enlarged 2.4L turbocharged boxer engine. Symmetrical all-wheel drive with driver-controlled center differential. Manual transmission standard, CVT optional. No STI variant for this generation. Difficulty modifier reflects turbocharged engine maintenance and performance-oriented components. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza WRX article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Sixth-generation Impreza compact car on Subaru Global Platform. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Available in sedan and hatchback body styles. Manual transmission available on base models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation Crosstrek (XV in some markets) subcompact crossover. Based on Impreza platform with increased ground clearance. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Manual transmission available on base models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru XV article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: EV: Dual electric motors (215 hp combined)
notes: Battery electric SUV co-developed with Toyota (bZ4X twin). Built on e-TNGA platform with 72.8 kWh battery pack. Dual-motor all-wheel drive system. Approximately 228 miles EPA range. Difficulty modifier reflects EV high-voltage system service requirements and specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Solterra article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation BRZ sports coupe co-developed with Toyota (GR86 twin). Rear-wheel drive layout unique among modern Subarus. Naturally aspirated 2.4L boxer engine with increased displacement. Low center of gravity and balanced handling. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru BRZ article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Three-row midsize SUV built in Lafayette, Indiana. Largest Subaru SUV available in North America. Seating for up to eight passengers. Turbocharged 2.4L boxer engine standard. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Ascent article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 2.0L FB20 boxer H4 + electric motor (148 hp combined)
notes: Plug-in hybrid variant of Crosstrek with 8.8 kWh battery pack. Electric-only range of approximately 17 miles. Combines boxer engine with electric motor for improved efficiency. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Difficulty modifier reflects PHEV high-voltage system complexity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru XV article, December 19, 2024 revision.
